definition: eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)

sentences.english: Skin biopsy revealed that papule contained cornoid lamellae on the top of the raised border.
sentences.chinese: 皮膚活檢顯示丘疹的邊緣隆起處有角化不全雞眼樣板。
我們有了一個新的治雞眼的醫生。

sentences.english: And silver nitrate is occasionally used to treat warts and corns.
sentences.chinese: 而硝酸銀可偶爾用於治療疣和雞眼。

sentences.english: Joe considers himself a quite competent corn surgeon .
sentences.chinese: 喬自以爲是個相當資深的雞眼外科醫生。

sentences.english: Dermatologists also warn that the friction between feet and shoes might cause corns.
sentences.chinese: 醫生還指出，腳和鞋經常發生摩擦，可能引起雞眼。

sentences.english: His watery crossed eyes rolled in exaltation .
sentences.chinese: 他得意洋洋地轉動着水汪汪的鬥雞眼。

sentences.english: He does not have a cock-eye, but his actions are cock-eyed .
sentences.chinese: 他沒有鬥雞眼，不過，他的行動卻是愚昧的。
一般來說，雞眼是會消失的。

sentences.english: For most people, eliminating the source of friction helps corns and calluses disappear.
sentences.chinese: 對大多數人來說，消除磨損源能讓雞眼和老繭消失。

sentences.english: The man is a sufferer from corns, gentlemen, and has no hip trouble at all.
sentences.chinese: 這個人得的是雞眼，先生，他臀部根本沒什麼問題。

sentences.english: What's the difference between a bunion and a corn?
sentences.chinese: 怎麼分辨姆囊炎和雞眼？

sentences.english: The machine forms eyelet specially for the riveting of inserted shank board and iron core.
sentences.chinese: 本機爲插中紙板與鐵心鈕合之專用雞眼機。

sentences.english: Cross-eyed opossum to join the Academy Awards Ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 德國鬥雞眼負鼠將現身奧斯卡。

definition: to have dark circles under one's eyes/to have eyes like a panda
the cap of a pen, pencil or writing brush/the sheath of a pen (made of cloth, silk or thread)
lit. firing after the horse/fig. belated action/giving advice in hindsight
